body.name: Goblin Slayer, Vol. 2 (Light Novel)
body.description: Goblins are the weakest of the monsters, with only numbers in their favor. No warrior would dedicate himself to their eradication—except for Goblin Slayer. As his reputation spreads, a quest comes from none other than the Supreme God's own archbishop—Sword Maiden, the Gold-ranked adventurer renowned for defeating a Demon Lord. The former hero brings a report of goblins beneath the flourishing, peaceful water town, followed by a plea for Goblin Slayer and his companions to investigate, since no one else will. Searching the catacombs beneath the town, though, the party discovers that the trouble runs far deeper than any of them realized. How are all these goblins entering the city? And why is Sword Maiden so desperate...?PLEASE NOTE: When you purchase this title, the accompanying PDF will be available in your Audible Library along with the audio. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5/5 Dead Goblins. Would Goblins Again.
reviews.reviewText: Goblins again. Goblins next time, as well. Goblins. Goblins. More Goblins.It's as brilliant as the first novel, and just as entertaining. People will try to change our Goblin Slayer, but even so - his priorities remain the same and his Goblin-slaying remains a constant work of art. Recommendable to anyone who enjoyed the first novel and knows what they're getting into - some of the art is a little risque, and some of the story's plot seems to incorporate this, alongside bloody, massacred Goblins and other strange creatures, but if you haven't seen the first novel - I can't say going straight to the second is wise.I look forward to the third's release. A-Goblin-Slaying we must go!~Ah, and to a certain extent; the amount of maidens falling into our Slayer's neglected harem continues to grow. Be warned - he's denser than even the most dedicated dwarves.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The adventure Continues
reviews.reviewText: Loved the 1st Volume? Will not be disappointed with the sequel that is Vol. 2. The interactions with the characters, the views on who Goblin Slayer is, what he means, and how much impact he has on people becomes noticeably mindblowing as you, the reader, become enthralled with this light novel. My only regret is at the speed i read this novel that leaves me with a satisfying smile for a story that I cannot wait to buy the Manga (Even if it might make my wallet weep).To the author, my thanks for the smiles, the horrors, the thrills, and triumph that shows how much work you have placed in this series. Please don't stop and keep it going!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An interesting read
reviews.reviewText: This volume of Goblin Slayer has our heroes slaying Goblins! Predictable and utterly enjoyable, I also loved the changing perspective of Goblin Slayer as he goes from being a lone wolf, to the defacto leader of his own group of Adventurers. I enjoyed reading the glimpses into the much larger universe and how they tie to Goblin Slayer and friends. Looking forward to reading volume 3.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good progression, refreshing
reviews.reviewText: Love the refreshing perspective. A simple MC doing the dirty work no one give much credit for doing. Some character development was good, if a bit dark. The brief chapters with hard to track perspectives is somewhat annoying but not as bad a most LN.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2017
reviews.reviewText: I was thrilled when I learned volume 2 was coming out around my birthday! Even though I held out on reading it until today so I could enjoy it without interruption. I'm glad I did!As with the last one the whole focus of Goblin Slayer is, of course, to slay goblins. He is acompanied by his newish party on his quest in a different region. The story is told a bit differently then last time but I enjoyed it just the same. I cannot wait for the next volume to come out! I wanna rwas more about Priestess as she is my favourite character along with Goblin Slayer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Send help I’m addicated, my wallet is evaporating
reviews.reviewText: Very biased report warningI love this, it’s where the anime ends, so it sucks that you (if you watched the anime) know what’s gonna happen, but being that we are able to know what everyone is thinking and have better details makes it entirely new. I’m currently running out of funds since I quit my job a while ago and ordering vol 3 and 4 have now finished the last hp my alley had.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent continuation from the first
reviews.reviewText: If you enjoyed the first book, you'll love this one - which focuses on longer style quests, rather than the short excursions seen in the first novel. Another refreshing, entertaining TTRPG-style narrative packed with interesting, unique companions, thoughtful world building, and perhaps the seeds of a deeper narrative arc for future novels to grow on.If the first book was an introduction to the world and characters, this was the first major quest in their campaign.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2018
reviews.reviewText: When first was exposed to mr Kagyu's imaginary world I was drawn to his Tolkien references sprinkled here and there. They are appealing to any true lover of fantasy in general and to rpg players in particular. When the second book reveals the mentor of the protagonist to be a follower of the actual legend of Bilbo Baggins I found myself completly enthralled. Bilbo Lives!
Another pearl of fantasy, based on RPGs like D&D. This book is pure joy, at least for those who understand a little bit of the genre
These books add or spell out worthwhile details that might be otherwise passed over or missed in the manga or show.

Han pasado varios meses desde que nuestro particular grupo se ha formado, aunque sus habilidades individuales no han mostrado un cambio significativo su trabajo colectivo ha dado pasos agigantados, tal vez ahora puedan realizar un trabajo serio... Siempre y cuando se trate de goblins.Una nueva mision ha sido presentada al gremio, pero esta vez solicitan directamente a nuestro protagonista, el remitente no es mas que la legendaria heroína de rango oro Sword Maiden.En este volumen la trama esta centrada en esta mision, el desarrollo de los personajes es mas notorio, particularmente Goblin Slayer el cual es mas abierto e incluso involuntariamente sarcástico, otro punto que resalto es la presencia de fanservice, el cual es bastante notorio pero no tan abrumador como en otras obras.Recuerden estar siempre alerta y reportar cualquier actividad goblin a su gremio mas cercano o directamente a Goblin Slayer, que actualmente se encuentra en una misión de patrulla seria.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 6, 2018
reviews.reviewText: This novel much like the first sees Goblin Slayer doing what he does best. Slaying, well... Goblins. Much like the first one, their is plenty of gore and scenes that make your teeth chatter. I'd recommend reading in a well lit room, with a not quite full stomach.
